Package org.lgdcloudsim.interscheduler

Interface InterScheduler

All Superinterfaces:
DatacenterEntity, Identifiable, Nameable
All Known Implementing Classes:
InterSchedulerLeastRequested, InterSchedulerRound, InterSchedulerSimple
public interface InterScheduler extends Nameable, DatacenterEntity
It is an interface for the inter-scheduler. The inter-scheduler can exist in the CloudInformationService as the only centralized inter-scheduler for each collaboration area. It can also exist in each data center as a distributed inter-scheduler. In the current design, only one centralized inter-scheduler can exist in each collaboration zone, and only one inter-scheduler can exist in each data center. TODO We will add support for multiple inter-scheduler parallel scheduling architectures in the near future. The basic scheduling unit of the inter-scheduler is the InstanceGroup. Each inter-scheduler maintains two InstanceGroupQueue of instance groups: one for normally scheduled groups and another for groups awaiting rescheduling due to previous scheduling failures. The inter-scheduler synchronously acquires the customizable state of various data centers from each data centerâ€™s StatesManager, like the total remaining resources of each data center. The data content obtained synchronously is determined by setDcStateSynType(java.util.Map<org.lgdcloudsim.datacenter.Datacenter, java.lang.String>). If the synchronization interval is set to 0, it means real-time synchronization. The synchronization interval is determined by setDcStateSynInterval(java.util.Map<org.lgdcloudsim.datacenter.Datacenter, java.lang.Double>). Scheduling will take time in simulation, you can get it through getScheduleTime(), the default is to count the real scheduling time. During scheduling, the scheduling will be completed at the start time of the schedulingCloudSimTag.INTER_SCHEDULE_BEGIN, and the time spent on the scheduling will be counted, and then the scheduling end eventCloudSimTag.INTER_SCHEDULE_END will be sent. The delay in the occurrence of the scheduling end eventCloudSimTag.INTER_SCHEDULE_END is the time spent on the scheduling just counted. The scheduler has three scheduling types depending on the scheduling target now:
  • The scheduling target is a host in the data center: It is implemented by the InterSchedulerSimple.scheduleToHost(java.util.List<org.lgdcloudsim.request.InstanceGroup>) function. It not only determines the data center to which each instance group will be scheduled, but also determines the hosts in the data center to which each instance in the instance group will be scheduled.
  • The scheduling target is a data center: It is implemented by the InterSchedulerSimple.scheduleToDatacenter(java.util.List<org.lgdcloudsim.request.InstanceGroup>) function. It only determines the data center to which each instance group will be scheduled. There is another key attribute here, which is whether the scheduled instance group is allowed to be forwarded after sent to the target data center. If forwarding is no longer allowed, it will enter the scheduling process in the data center and be scheduled by IntraScheduler. If forwarding is allowed, it will be sent to the target data center and be scheduled by the inter-scheduler in the target data center again.
  • The scheduling target is a mix of hosts and data centers: It is implemented by the InterSchedulerSimple.scheduleMixed(java.util.List<org.lgdcloudsim.request.InstanceGroup>) function. It schedules instances in some instance groups to hosts in this data center, and forwards the remaining instance groups to other data centers. It also has the attribute of whether the scheduled instance group is allowed to be forwarded after sent to the target data center.
Different types of inter-schedulers are suitable for use in different types of inter-data center scheduling architectures. The host-targeted inter-scheduler is suitable for use in the centralized inter-scheduler of the collaboration zone in CIS(@link org.lgdcloudsim.core.CloudInformationService). The data center-targeted-no-forwarding inter-scheduler is suitable for use in the centralized inter-scheduler of the collaboration zone in CIS(@link org.lgdcloudsim.core.CloudInformationService). It means that after the centralized inter-scheduler distributes the request to each data center, it is further scheduled by the IntraScheduler in the data center. The data center-targeted-forwarding inter-scheduler is alse suitable for use in the centralized inter-scheduler of the collaboration zone in CIS(@link org.lgdcloudsim.core.CloudInformationService). It means that after the centralized inter-scheduler distributes the request to each data center, it is further scheduled by the inter-scheduler in the target data center. The mixed-targeted inter-scheduler is suitable for use in the distributed inter-scheduler in each data center. It is used to schedule instance group scheduled from the centralized data center-targeted-forwarding inter-scheduler. It also can be used in no-centralized inter-scheduler scheduling architecture, then it can schedule the instance group received to other data centers or hosts in its own data center. If you need to customize an inter-scheduler, we do not recommend that you directly implement interScheduler. Instead, we recommend that you directly extend InterSchedulerSimple and then implement several key scheduling functions, including InterSchedulerSimple.scheduleToHost(java.util.List<org.lgdcloudsim.request.InstanceGroup>), InterSchedulerSimple.scheduleToDatacenter(java.util.List<org.lgdcloudsim.request.InstanceGroup>), and InterSchedulerSimple.scheduleMixed(java.util.List<org.lgdcloudsim.request.InstanceGroup>). The InterSchedulerLeastRequested may be a good example for you to refer to.
Since:
LGDCloudSim 1.0
Author:
Anonymous

  • Method Details

    • schedule

      InterSchedulerResult schedule()
      Get a batch of instance groups from the instance group queue for scheduling. It will call different scheduling functions according to the scheduling target.
      Returns:
      the result of the scheduling.

    • getScheduleTime

      double getScheduleTime()
      Get the time spent on the scheduling.
      Returns:
      the time spent on the scheduling.

      Returns:

      InterScheduler setCollaborationId(int collaborationId)

      collaborationId - the collaboration id.
      Returns:
      the inter-scheduler itself.

    • setDcStateSynType

      InterScheduler setDcStateSynType(Map<Datacenter,String> dcStateSynType)
      Set the state synchronization type of each data center. Depending on the state type, the StatesManager will return different types of state copies.
      Parameters:
      dcStateSynType - the state synchronization type of each data center.
      Returns:
      the inter-scheduler itself.
      See Also:
      • StatesManager.getStateByType(String)

    • synBetweenDcState

      void synBetweenDcState(List<Datacenter> datacenters)
      Get the state synchronization type of each data center. If the synchronization interval to some data centers is 0, it will call this function to get the latest simple state of the data centers. For other data centers whose synchronization period is not 0, it will periodically call this function for synchronization.
      Parameters:
      datacenters - the data centers.

    • addUserRequests

      void addUserRequests(List<UserRequest> userRequests)
      Add user requests to the instance group queue.
      Parameters:
      userRequests - the user requests to be added.

    • addInstanceGroups

      void addInstanceGroups(List<InstanceGroup> instanceGroups, boolean isRetry)
      Add instance groups to the instance group queue. If the isRetry is true, it means that the instance groups are added for retry instance group queue.
      Parameters:
      instanceGroups - the instance groups to be added.
      isRetry - indicates whether the instance groups are added for retry.

    • isQueuesEmpty

      boolean isQueuesEmpty()
      Get whether the instance group queue is empty.
      Returns:
      whether the instance group queue is empty.

    • getNewQueueSize

      int getNewQueueSize()
      Get the size of the instance group queue for new instance groups.
      Returns:
      the size of the instance group queue for new instance groups.

    • getRetryQueueSize

      int getRetryQueueSize()
      Get the size of the instance group queue for retry instance groups.
      Returns:
      the size of the instance group queue for retry instance groups.

    • getTraversalTime

      int getTraversalTime()
      Get the number of traversal times. If you don't update the traversal time in your scheduling strategy, it will return 0.
      Returns:
      the number of traversal times.
